chargeHist.descr: Possess Firearm-Adjudicated Deliquent of a Felony

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jovanni Marquez Vazquez not in court, in custody.  
Attorney Connor Romenesko in court for Jovanni Marquez Vazquez.  
Attorney Samuel E. Simpson in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for Scheduling Conference. 
Defense in receipt of discovery and offer from the State and request a plea and sentencing date. 
Defense advised to file the plea documents 24 hours in advance of the hearing,. 
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19. 
Plea and Sentencing scheduled January 19, 2022 at 2:00pm.

Defendant Jovanni Marquez Vazquez in court, in custody.  
Attorney Connor Romenesko in court for Jovanni Marquez Vazquez.  
Attorney Samuel E. Simpson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant Mother ( NV) appears via zoom.
Victim ( CK) appears via zoom.

Case in court for a Scheduling Conference tagging along with Case 22CF3186. 
Hearing held on pending matter and adjourned for further proceedings. This case to follow. . 
Case remains calendared in Branch 19.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services DISCHARGE Report ( defendant in custody) received and filed.

Attorney Connor Romenesko in court, defendant Jovanni Marquez Vazquez not in court, in custody.  
Student intern Caroline Pelligrini supervised by Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Defense request an adjournment due to defendant pending felony matter ( 22CF3186), which is scheduled for a preliminary hearing.
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Crivello.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Ashley, Br. 19.

Defendant Jovanni Marquez Vazquez in court with Attorney Connor Romenesko.  Defendant Jovanni Marquez Vazquez in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Court took judicial notice of 21JV1188. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective J. Bohn. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch .  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Jovanni Marquez Vazquez in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Defendant Jovanni Marquez Vazquez in custody.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jovanni Marquez Vazquez appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Laura A. Crivello, Branch 36,  in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 2.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
